title: Is It Time To WAKE UP?
body_text:
Let's just cut right to chase ...
EastCoastDodgeball has been ever-so blessed in its two years-plus existence and the forthcoming confrontations are sure reasons why. Anyone who debates or argues that point must be living under a shell.
Rob Pellecchia, Bobby Vetrano, Kevin Megill, Chris Adams
- four of the most celebrated and respected athletes share the spotlight to conclude what has truly been a fantastically star-studded, one-of-a-kind 13th Season.
Pellecchia, Vetrano at 129
These young sensations enter unfamiliar territory at DODGEBALL 129 as neither have ever been granted the coveted team general's position - until now. And despite few physical altercations between the two, one must have been hibernating to have not predicted this soon-to-be epic collision.
The lions of old took immediate notice at the monumental debut of prodigy
Rob Pellecchia
. This 14 year-old all-star carries all the goods - speed, agility, power, heart - traits that catapulted  this 2007
ROOKIE of the Year
nominee to the top of the ranks. His counterpart in this 129th showdown isn't just another face in the crowd either.
The success of elder cousin, the legendary Ryan Letsche, could easily be associated with the 15 year-old mogul
Bobby Vetrano
right from his beginning days. Enduring rivalries with superpowers Tom Adams, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Kevin Adams, and even Letsche himself have put and kept the kid on the map.
The electricity generated from these two young bucks will indeed be felt court-wide. Catch this feverishly-awaited encounter on March 8.
DODGEBALL C30 coming March 15
This epic needs no hype -
Chris Adams
versus
Kevin Megill
at the one and only Season 13 Finale. The pregame
"MoneyMaker" Rimshot Contest
as well as the celebratory  Pete & Elda's gathering are just a fraction for what's in store for the grandest event of the year.
body_html:
Let's just cut right to chase ...

EastCoastDodgeball has been ever-so blessed in its two years-plus existence and the forthcoming confrontations are sure reasons why. Anyone who debates or argues that point must be living under a shell. Rob Pellecchia, Bobby Vetrano, Kevin Megill, Chris Adams - four of the most celebrated and respected athletes share the spotlight to conclude what has truly been a fantastically star-studded, one-of-a-kind 13th Season.

Pellecchia, Vetrano at 129
These young sensations enter unfamiliar territory at DODGEBALL 129 as neither have ever been granted the coveted team general's position - until now. And despite few physical altercations between the two, one must have been hibernating to have not predicted this soon-to-be epic collision.

The lions of old took immediate notice at the monumental debut of prodigy Rob Pellecchia. This 14 year-old all-star carries all the goods - speed, agility, power, heart - traits that catapulted this 2007 ROOKIE of the Year nominee to the top of the ranks. His counterpart in this 129th showdown isn't just another face in the crowd either.

The success of elder cousin, the legendary Ryan Letsche, could easily be associated with the 15 year-old mogul Bobby Vetrano right from his beginning days. Enduring rivalries with superpowers Tom Adams, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Kevin Adams, and even Letsche himself have put and kept the kid on the map.

The electricity generated from these two young bucks will indeed be felt court-wide. Catch this feverishly-awaited encounter on March 8.

DODGEBALL C30 coming March 15
This epic needs no hype - Chris Adams versus Kevin Megill at the one and only Season 13 Finale. The pregame "MoneyMaker" Rimshot Contest as well as the celebratory Pete & Elda's gathering are just a fraction for what's in store for the grandest event of the year.
